summary: New York lawyer Vinny has never won a case. When his teenage cousin Bill and his friend Stan are accused of murder in a backwater Alabama town, it's up to the nervous Vinny to save him from jail, even though he's only ever tried personal injury cases before, and none of them successfully.

reviews.content: We were surprised at how poorly this movie has 'aged'. The dialogue was clipped and only mildly funny. The main, redeeming feature was seeing the sexy Marisa Tomei.

I stumbled across this movie on a streaming platform and decided to watch, having previously seen it in a theater when it came out more than three decades ago. Tomei is awesome with Pesci not far behind. The bickering between the two was extremely funny from the first time they appeared right through the start of credits rolling. Great movie revolving almost entirely around the two leads. I'm sorry I waited so long to watch it a second time. If you like (mostly) clean comedy, this movie is worth watching.

I'll say it's CUTE, but this courtroom comedy about a lawyer hired to try a murder case is somewhat grating. This IS Joe Pesci's movie, and Pesci as the lawyer Vinny is quite good, getting better at this law business as he goes along. The whole thing is overshadowed of course by Marisa Tomei as his dim-as-a-bulb girlfriend, who has a few trick up her sleeve. Tomei won the Oscar for this, I will say it's unjustified. It really is a nothing part without any oomph in it.
this movie has Joe Pesci
Fantastic! Well put story and plot with well thought out jokes.

My Cousin Vinny is an amusing courtroom comedy that offers more than just a silly display to garner laughs. While it takes a bit of time to kick off, once Pesci and Tomei take the wheel, it's all smooth sailing with plenty of humor and wit. The courtroom scenes are the best and well worth sitting through the entire movie for.

Catchy theme from the very start, with an interesting setting for a very good timed comedy; Joe Pesci interpretation alone is worth the shot. Praise to Marisa Tomei's performance, bringing the much needed powerlifting energy on an otherwhise too much enduring movie.

I can't hide i "cringed" a little at the stutter scene.
An entertaining, and interesting look into the US legal system, elevated by performances from a great cast.
I really enjoyed this movie. Though the story was a bit simplistic, the jokes made up for it.
.."No self-respecting southerner uses instant grits" ...  (A great line in the movie, and one that my mom and grandma would definitely agree with it!)  :D

It's been 30 years since the release of this film at the time I'm writing this review in September of 2022, and I'm just seeing it for the first time. I guess I missed this one?? I know it was a hit back in '92 but I'm afraid it comes across as a product of it's time. Not Pesci's best performance by far, in my opinion, and overall it fell flat with  occasional moments that gave me a little chuckle. I dunno, I just wasn't feelin' this one.

I'd heard about this movie since my childhood in the 90s. Never saw it until last night. Was totally taken by this film!

Fun and funny and Tomei absolutely creates one of the most memorable characters in film  I've ever seen, totally steals every scene she's in!

5 years ago- Between Joe Pesci and Marisa Tomei's endless chemistry to nonstop visual gags to Herman Munster as a truly terrifying judge, the film works on multiple levels as both a hilarious comedy and a well thought out legal film
Surprisingly good and funny!
Certified comedy classic.

Allegedly, this film has been praised by lawyers as one of the more realistic movies about the justice system and the lawyer profession. Joe Pesci as Vinny proves that well-written sharply paced superbly delivered jokes belong in comedies.

"My Cousin Vinny" is a movie that works almost entirely because of its sharp script and high-energy performances. This movie feels entertaining all the way through because the characters are just a lot of fun to watch and the story is pretty engaging. Even though it is somewhat repetitive until the final act, I had a good time watching it and felt it paid off. It's clear why Marisa Tomei won an Oscar for this movie as her performance is an example of a truly great supporting role. Joe Pesci also gives a memorable comedic performance here and plays a lovable character. Overall, it is a funny and enjoyable movie from the 90s that put me in a great mood and kept me entertained.

Idc how much this movie makes fun of the south, everybody can have a sense of humor and good time watching it! The acting from Joe Pesci and Marisa Tomei was superb, and I even liked the performance from the grumpy judge! Sure it felt dull in a few scenes, but overall it was undoubtedly a quality early 90s movie!
very fun to watch joe pesci
One that I saw on tv a few times.  It keeps your interest.
It's a classic. No question at all. It's funny, it's enjoyable, it's worth the almost 2 hours of this movie. 5/5

Classic film that every person in law school or interested in law should watch. Pretty accurate depiction of a real life court room. Then when you take into account that the film is hilarious, and has very easy characters to root for, you end up realizing that this is in fact a clever film that deserves its cult classic status.
Very funny, well-written, and endearing. I wasn't expecting to like this so much, but here we are!

This is a timeless, hilarious film with stellar
performances from the cast and a surprisingly engaging
plot for a comedy film. This is a movie in which
everything goes wrong in the funniest way possible.
Vinny's antics never really get old, due largely in part to
Joe Pesci's charisma and some great directing. Marisa
Tomei deserves a mention as well, of course; the way
her character bickers with Vinny just pops off the
screen.

By the third act, not only did I not know how our
characters were going to get out of everything, I didn't
even know what was going on - but I was dying to
know! I can't believe how engaging this ridiculous court
case is . I wish the real legal system was this damn
entertaining. It's cute, funny, and surprisingly gripping,
and I would absolutely recommend it to anyone.
Seriously, just watch it; it's so good.
Well thought out story and worth watching.  Joe Pesci , Marrissa Tomei are spectacular. Great cast. Clever top class comedy as well. 5 stars
One of the most procedurally accurate and funniest courtroom movies ever made.
Maybe a little too long but once the court case gets rolling in the second half and Pesci and Tomei take center stage the movie takes flight and becomes enormously entertaining and often very funny.
Safe to say we can now call this a classic, what would otherwise be a tired and dull dialougue, Pesci and friends make this sharp as a tack.

A cult classic, Starring Joe Pesci (Goodfellas, Casino, Home Alone and Home Alone 2: Lost in New York) and Ralph Macchio (Karate Kid 1,2, and 3 and Netflix Hit Series Cobra Kai. It's a comedic fun campy film that is good for a day off or to relax. The film also stars Marisa Tomei. Joe Pesci's role is lighter than Casino and Goodfellas but has the feel of his character in Home Alone and Home Alone 2: Lost in New York.

Pesci and Gwynne are very funny but Marisa Tomei makes this movie great. The moment she gets out of the car in that short tight skirt and lets that accent loose, you're in love. In the finale, you get goosebumps when she explains 1964 Buicks to a room full of men.
My cousin Vinny is one of the funnies movies of the 90's.
This is a very hilarious and entertaining film that never leaves you bored
It's y'all in Alabama and youse guys in New York.   Strange people  from the North engage with odd characters in the South.   It's hilarious.  Welcome to America.

When it comes to courtroom movies, there aren't many more entertaining than My Cousin Vinny. Joe Pesci and Marisa Tomei carry most of this film on their shoulders, but Fred Gwynne is a delight to watch in his final performance, as well. I learned a lot of what I know about legal proceedings from My Cousin Vinny, it's very well written, and I find myself chuckling every time I watch it.
Hilarious movie!! One of my favorite movies !!! And Marisa Tomei is gorgeous!!!
A really funny comedy with Joe Pesci that has a great story and fast paced from beginning to end.

It was okay but a bit slow in the middle. As a comedy, it doesn't succeed often enough. But as a lighthearted tale of a struggling, inexperienced lawyer looking to prove himself in a foreign state, it kept my interest the first time I watched it. The second time, I found it difficult to get into.

You don't think of Joe Pesci and Marisa Tomei as "comedic" actors but they really pull off the city folk lost in the county schtick. But the supporting cast fills in huge gaps in the movie including Fred Gwynne as the judge. Against impossible odds Joe Pesci will defend his cousin in a murder trial (Ralph Macchio) regardless of the backwards country law, country lawyers and a mean judge. His battle to do the impossible makes for many humorous situations. I'd say even a 3.75 rating
Joe Pesci and Marisa Tomei are hilarious in this movie.
A great movie from Pesci outside of his usual gangster characters.
This is exactly what I wanted and more.

I think Joe Pesci is a great actor both comedically and dramatically, but My Cousin Vinny sadly doesn't bring any of that general charm to his performance. What I found most tragic was how dull and forgettable this film was, which is strange seeing how even though Pesci (who is usually the most interesting part of any film he's in) has a leading role, he's somehow not as memorable in this as his supporting roles.
"My Cousin Vinny" is like a slice of New York pizza: never fails to bring a smile to your face, and although it's predictable, there's nothing more delicious. This film is never going out of style.

Pesci SHINES in this 'Yankee goes South' take on the legal system. Add a fast-talking Marisa Tomei and a plot that puts DIxie charm against northern flash, and you've got a heart warming black comedy tale. Emotionally the performances connect, even if you don't empathize with the falsely accused as much as you'd like. More Pesci please.

Good entertaining movie starring a very young marisa tomei and the guy from goodfellas and home alone who I always forget his name. I really enjoyed this movie, the chemistry between the two is phenomenal. I wonder if they did any other movies together besides this. And congrats on Marisa tomei winning an Oscar for this film, she was indeed the stand out in this movie.
This is one of my favorite movies. I find myself watching it over and over. And I almost never watch movies twice, let alone numerous times.
This is my favorite comedy film of all time. This film is really funny and Joe Pesci does a great job in this film. It is my favorite film of 1992.
Smartly written and performed. Marisa Tomei certainly pulls off a unique character. It is hilarious, smartly-done, fulfilling entertainment, though not so deeply purposeful.
Great storyline with plenty of laughs but the trial couldn't have come soon enough. It was the best part and everything before it was just filler. (63%)
The acting is impeccable and the movie never fails to make you laugh. Such an amazing movie with an interesting plotline. Joe Pesci did a spectacular job and he fits into the movie so well.
Great performances and a fun plot.

A funny and entertaining movie, through and through. It has a great story, decent acting, and the plot is easy enough to follow. Many movies set in the courthouse fail to keep the viewer from getting lost in the complex machine that is the government. This movie balances it just right. Definitely worth a watch.

My Cousin Vinny, directed by Jonathan Lynn, produced by Dale Launer & Paul Schiff, was respectfully one of the most accurate law movies that's been put out, to date. With My Cousin Vinny being a court room movie, somehow Jonathan Lynn incorporated this great comedic twist, to this nobale premise, that blended just right with Joe Pecsi's lead. With a script that can be predictable at times, Pesci brought his seasoned charisma to really drive this movie. Dale Launer put together such a hilarious, yet super witty script, holding a lot of weight, keeping everyone thoroughly entertained the whole time.

David Rubin went all out, casting this brilliant cast, that blended so well together! Recently, coming off of JFK, and being known for Home Alone & Lethal Weapon, Joe Pesci shined bright in this film! He was so friggen hilarious, while having this sarcastic wit, that seems to get him through a lot, yet get him into a lot. He put on such an entertaining performance, having this off tone personality, developing into a somewhat civilized professional. Marisa Toemi also put on such a great performance as the main supportive character. This was definitively her best performance of her whole career, winning her first and only Academy Award for her performance. Her character often got shadowed on purpose, foreshadowing her wit, making her character that much more enjoyable come the third act. Ralph Macchio was the driving reason for the film. Right off the bat, Jonathan Lynn made it real easy to get behind, and root for Macchio, by letting us in on the truth. Fred Gwynne as Judge Chamberlain Haller, was a great plot device. His character was so blunt, and right to the point, where him and Joe Peaci had more than a handful of enjoyable scenes.

The costume designer in Carol Wood did such a fantastic job. For a movie that talks about the costumes for a decent portion of the film, Carol Wood made sure to put her creativity on display, and it paid off tremendously.

Victoria Paul created these unique sets. She incorporated great set pieces, creating this authentic looking court room, also creating this great representation of good ol', muddy Alabama.

I've been enjoying My Cousin Vinny for as long as I can remember; watching it so many times, I've only picked up on a few defects. The only complaints I have, there are a few convenient scenes, and that it takes some liberties with the law also making things extra theatrical. Overall, I know I can always go to this movie on for a good laugh. If anyone ever asks for a Joe Pesci movie, besides his gang affiliated movies, this would be my go to!
Rather thin plot is elevated by the interplay of Joe Pesci and Marisa Tomei in this fish-out-of-water story. Comical and careful not to veer into deep stereotype territory. Tomei steals the show.
My favorite comedy film of all time. This film is really funny and Joe Pesci does a great job in this film. It is my favorite film of 1992.

Absolutely hysterical. Easily my favorite comedy from the 90s and one of my favorites in general. Marisa Tomei gives the best performance by an actress in a comedy ever, and was more than deserving of her Oscar win. The casting and chemistry between all the actors is perfect.

The movie is increadibly slow-paced, boring and ill-conceived. There is no plot, no suspense. Humorous moments are few and far between. The premise is credible - anyone can become a victim of a mistrial. The rest is rubbish, cliches and padding which thinly veils the failure this movies is. People who say "aks" should be punished by law.  new york accent is disgusting.
This comedy drama is a classic and still a good movie. Marisa Tomei and Joe Pesci are a delight and give some wonderful performances.
Great movie I really enjoyed it. The beginning was a little stupid but everything after that was really good.
Classic movie and I would really recommend it.
The efforts of Marisa Tomei and Joe Pesci make My Cousin Vinny an enjoyable courtroom comedy.
Pretty good movie it was very funny and good the first time but it gets old the second time but its still good to rent maybe not buy

The funniest law movie I've seen in years. The film uses fish-out-of-water scenarios, Southern stereotypes and courtroom fourplay to its comedic advantage and tells a thrilling story of an unexperienced lawyer taking on a big case.

This comedy classic is very funny and entertaining. Joe Pesci, Ralph Macchio, Marisa Tomei, Mitchell Whitfield, and the rest of the cast did a fantastic job in this movie. The plot to the movie was very funny and mind-blowing. If you haven't seen this movie yet, check it out sometime. It's a must see.

My Cousin Vinny has an unconventional humor and a great performance by Marisa Tomei which makes it fun to watch, despite that, it is not a masterpiece and leaves something to be desired in several moments of bad dialogues

A 90's classic.

It's nice seeing a movie where Joe Pesci isn't the crazy little guy in the Mafia.

The dialogue is great, funny, and believable. It's even funnier because they sound like what a real-life Vinny's would say.﻿ Sensed a real solid dynamic between Pesci and Tomei.

Not to mention that scene where Tomei quotes all those car facts.

3.5/5. 1.5 star off for being a bit aged, but still holds up solid.

End note: Anyone notice that Legally Blonde shares the same plot as this movie?

My Cousin Vinny is one of the greater comedies ever created. It's sweet, lighthearted, and unabashedly hilarious at times. It's most awe-inspiring characteristic is it's performances, with Joe Pesci being absolutely fantastic along with Marisa Tomei, who  may somehow be even better.

This movie is awful. Tomei's New York accent equals Dick Van Dykes' Cockney accent in "Mary Poppins" in dreadfulness. A straight to video creation if ever there was one. It's 87% freshness rating makes me weep for my fellow human beings.  Paint a wall and watch it dry for two hours instead, is what I recommend. BOO! HISS!

My 1st Viewing Of "My Cousin Vinny" Was Actually Some Snippets Of The Film On TV Once. Now I Have Finally Watched It Full-Through! The Story Is Intriguing As We See 2 Pals Bill & Stan, Played By Ralph Macchio Of "The Karate Kid" (1984)-Fame & Mitchell Whitfield, Being Accused Of Murder After They Simply Just Took A Can Of Tuna At A Small Out-Of-Nowhere Store. During The Struggle, Along Comes Harry From "Home Alone" (1990) & "Home Alone 2: Lost In New York" (1992), Joe Pesci As Bill's Cousin Vinny To Build His Way Up To Be A Better Lawyer In The Judge's Taste As He Solves Parts Of The Mystery With The Help Of His Sassy But EXTREMELY SEXY Wife *whistle whistle* Mona Lisa Vito, Played By Marisa Tomei.

Now, About The Film: The Comedic Duo Of Pesci & Tomei Is Enjoyable To Watch. They Are What Elevate The Film's Story, Even Though You Can't Help But Feel That The Script Is Predictable. As Our Jailbirds, Mitchell Whitfield & Ralph Macchio Seem Mostly Wasted In The Cast. I Know They're Key Cast Members But Could We At Least See Them Go Through Some Experiences Some People Have Actually Dealt With In Jail Or Prison, But Not To When It Goes Too Far? And The Courtroom Scenes Are Funny Whenever Joe Pesci Stands Up In Court To Defend The 2 Guys, Even Though The Courtroom Scenes Tend To Drag A Little Bit.

But From A Postive Reevaluation, I Think The Main Thing You Actually Wanna See When It Comes To This '90s Comedy Is Our Married Couple From Brooklyn. Overall, "My Cousin Vinny" Is A Good Movie; For It Has 2 Great & Funny Actors, & A Handful Of Laughs Here & There, But Predictable Writing, It's The Execution Of The Film's Deft Interplay Between The Husband & Wife That Makes The Movie. Check It Out, It's A Good 1.

A lightweight comedy that will appeal to anyone who enjoys stories about the law.  It is surprisingly good at handling how real lawyers act.  There are no villains here just honest people trying to do justice. Marisa Tomei steals the show.

One of the best start-to-end comedies of all time. I wish this was serialized. I could watch this dynamic duo of detectives bring down anybody. They could take on Skreli, or the dude from the Fyre festival. Who cares? I just want to see them go.
loved every minute of it. Very easy to watch.
One of the best comedies ever.
One of the greatest lawyer movie ever made, its funny but serious. Marrisa Tomei and Joe Pesci chemistry is so good and unforgetable

What a good time in throwback hubby and wife date night to 'My Cousin Vinny'.  Well worth the wait for wife, while an old friend to hubby.  This movie flies by and each character is hilarious in this well-written whodunit.  Ralph Macchio is always easy on wife's eyes while hubby didn't mind Marisa Tomei's.  There are few movies made that hold up like this.  It just works in all instances.  There are even sight gags that are effective.  Joe Pesci is over the top, but it's not a bad thing. Hubby: 9.7/ Wife: 9.1 Average Final Score:  9.4

The humor is actually pretty fun in this. Marisa Tomei and Joe Pesci have decent chemistry. The story unfolds at a decent pace. If you enjoy courtroom movies that are light hearted in its tone then its worth a watch.

One of Pesci's best comedic films. It's got wit, a good story, and is well acted. And the law is pretty close to "real" as far as can be said of any law movie. Frederick Gwynn as the judge was made for this part.
Brilliant and funny. The courtroom dramas always infinite my interest, this fits the bill
Smart, funny, slick and well-paced look at jurisprudence and the South with scene stealing performances from Tomei, Pesci and a youtful Karate Kid
It's Joe Pesci being funny. Like, ha-ha funny.
My Cousin Vinny is my favorite Joe Pesci comedy. It's funny and fast paced.

It had a lot of laughs in the beginning with him floundering his way through being a trial lawyer with an uptight judge. However, the premise was a bit ridic and Vinny was a bit too old for Tomei. The ending I was like really it was like scooby-dooish? Idk it passed the time but not the most interesting/plausible law film out there.
As perfect of a film as you can get.

A hilarious comedy of errors with courtroom drama!

Jonathan Lynn's comedic courtroom drama My Cousin Vinny (1992) is a delightful comedy film. It takes great care with its clever script in order to maintain an accurate portrayal of a courtroom's procedure, while spoofing the entire ordeal. It is filled with fun outfits, music, and performances. Lynn's My Cousin Vinny is a rightful courtroom classic and a must see for fans of comedies and courtroom dramas. It brought me constant laughter and plenty to think about in regards to courtroom etiquette.

First of all, Joe Pesci is awesome. His idiotic, but well meaning lawyer from New York is just so much fun to watch. Pesci plays a new lawyer learning as he goes, a devoted fiancee that ignores his endearing, helpful lady, all while trying to help out his cousin and aspire to be a real lawyer. Pesci is really great at screaming loudly and delivering monologues and he does both in My Cousin Vinny. I love that Pesci can capture a genuine man dreaming of the law that can help someone, while not knowing anything about conducting himself in a courtroom. He gives a great anecdote about the judge that inspired him to be a lawyer as well as delivering classic comedy moments in Alabama and sweet interactions with Marisa Tomei.

Speaking of Tomei, My Cousin Vinny got her an Oscar for Best Supporting Actress! This was well deserved as her New Jersey accent, glaring attitude, earnest helpfulness, and mechanical knowledge are all impressive. Tomei is electrifying every time she is on screen. She acts toe to toe with Joe Pesci in his prime. Marisa Tomei gave the performance of a lifetime in My Cousin Vinny.

The rest of the supporting cast are no slouches as My Cousin Vinny features a wide array of character actors. Ralph Macchio is endearing and likable as a wrongly accused man alongside Mitchell Whitfield. Fred Gwynne's strictly by the book of procedure judge is a hilarious tough foil for Pesci's easy going lawyer. Lane Smith's prosecutor is rigid, yet friendly enough that you only hate him for being crooked. Bruce McGill's sheriff is amiable and fun. Lastly, Austin Pendleton gives a gut busting performance at the nervous and inept state appointed public defender. You will not forget any of these wonderful characters thanks to the admirable acting from these character actors.

I loved My Cousin Vinny. Joe Pesci and Marisa Tomei just capture your attention and hold it to the end. It's hard to believe this movie was almost 2 full hours as it only feels like 1, if that. I think most audiences will be entertained by My Cousin Vinny.

Joe Pesci is hilarious in what is perhaps the most realistic courtroom film. Did Marisa Tomei deserve to win an Oscar for her role? Well, can you still remember a performance by any other actress that year? Tomei's performance was unforgettable.
I love this movie. Entertaining as hell from start to finish.

your gullibility towards this sweet tale won't end up..

My Cousin Vinny

Lynn's mockery over the judicial system and the lower mentality of the society works like a charm that sweeps away its runtime in front of your eyes and your gullibility towards this sweet tale won't end up. It is not flat out hilarious. Maybe, because it doesn't try too hard. It is happy in its convenience. And it's that flow that makers doesn't wish to stop and neither do we. Satisfied within its range, this soothing feature endorses your textbook comic sequence with a bit of drama imputed in it that helps it make it more grounded and practical. And giving the script a hand, is the performance that makes it more pragmatic and believable. This hilarious casting is apt for this sort of storyline.

Pesci on the driver's seat has been allotted basically his home ground. This is his forte. Whether then be it to argue without any knowledge or do physical comedy, his range never fails to surprise you. His comic timing is off the roof. But this isn't a one man army war. The story demands a better guide to this protagonist and Tomei is just the actor to portray this character. Her accent, her whining over little things and a vital "witness" to this case, she is a competition to Pesci. Their bittersweet relationship is the trump card of the feature.

The narration though, is mediocre throughout the course. It's that flat line that is off putting. Even the courtroom drama offers you the expected chills and nothing extraordinary. Lynn manages to keep a big smile on your face thoroughly with Launer's simple and sensible script and his decent execution. There are no surprising elements, nothing to be mesmerized about. My Cousin Vinny is just like your cousin, you wouldn't leave your ears off when it has to say something, but you wouldn't miss it too, after the curtain drops.

"Ridiculous! All this over a can of tuna!"

This movie is HILARIOUS! I haven't laughed this hard in a while.
In the surface, My Cousin Vinny seems to be a small easy-going comedy movie with a fish-out-of-water/mistaken identity story, and that's exactly how should you see it to enjoy it, but that doesn't mean it's just that kind of a movie. This movie doesn't just have some smart jokes, and funny characters, but it's a clever, and kinda profound movie at its core. The way the sub-plots are connected to the character arc of Vinny, and how they reflect his development, and express his feelings, reminded me of the Coen Bros. quite a bit, but, of course, in a much lighter way. The funny misfortunes of Vinny are purely Coen-esque! And of course that means that the movie has a moral, and it's really an impressive, and sorta useful, one. It's a message about changing for better; a message about the indifference and how it's unprofitable, and even harmful.

As I mentioned that it's better to watch the movie as a comedy and nothing else, I did that and I think My Cousin Vinny almost excels on so many levels as a comedy. From the clever jokes, to the comical slap-stick direction style, to the both oddball and reasonable characters, I found myself enjoying every moment in the movie, and laugh constantly throughout its runtime.

Joe Pesci and Marisa Tomei's chemistry is just unparalleled! Needless to say that they delivered some of their best performances in their rich career bringing their already well-composed and well-designed characters to life. Especially Mona Lisa Vito, played by Marisa Tomei that I found she really has some depth that can rarely be found in comedy movies. She's a round character; stubborn, kinda sassy, yet smart and sensitive... and she's cute, too!
Mitchell Whitfield and Ralph Macchio, who played the two young New Yorkers, are also very good; they have a good chemistry as well, and their reactions to the misunderstanding at the beginning are hysterically funny.

The third act that take place in the courtroom is more serious, but that definitely doesn't mean it doesn't contain jokes or lack of humor. In addition to that, it has prepared for it very well. What surprised me is that I found the third act could be the most intriguing part of the movie. Due to the smartness of the script, the dialogue is pretty sharp, the denouement is surprisingly convincing, and the jokes this time is more clever because they rely on the writing and the acting, not the direction. I mean in a large part, obviously.

The dramatic moments at the let-downs, however, seem very forced, and didn't work for me at all. They really could have been balanced with the comical tone of the movie way better than that. The plot could seem a bit familiar, but the content, and many details feel so fresh you almost can't notice this familiarity except when the credits roll.

I want to praise Jonathan Lynn's classic visual style of comedy, but it's better to be seen to be appreciated. Please do yourself a favor, and watch this hidden, underappreciated gem.

(9/10)

My Cousin Vinny is an amalgamation of two things that I love. It has a hilarious fish-out-of-water story where these New Yorkers attempt to understand the inner workings of a small southern town. At the same time it has courtroom drama, with a ton of clever questioning and smart work by the lawyers. This movie never ceases to make me laugh and feel unending joy every time I watch it. Every cast member is superb and I love how they play all the comedy straight while I’m laughing like an idiot. I still remember how people were up in arms about Marisa Tomei winning a Supporting Actress Oscar that year, but she is so divine in this film that I cannot imagine anyone deserving it more. This is one of those movies that I can’t turn off if I happen to find it on TV, and I will watch until the end even if I just saw part of it the day before. There’s something so satisfying about the film, that it still works for me no matter how many times I see it. I recently watched it from start to finish for the first time in a long time, and I was struck by how well it still holds up to this day. I did my best to watch with a critical eye and search for nitpicks and flaws that others might have, and all I could find were a couple of scenes that felt edited slightly out of order, that might have flowed better if shuffled around. However it is very minor, and does nothing to hurt the story, so I didn’t care. My Cousin Vinny still holds as one of my all-time favorite films, and a movie I’ll be delighted to watch any time I have the opportunity.

My Cousin Vinny plays to the strengths of its stars, and accomplishes much from its simple concept. The main legal case storyline is satisfying to watch play out, and the rest of the cast glow with charm, but it is Tomei's and Pesci's show. Ultimately this movie is an easygoing good time that is worth the watch.
There are a few problems but it has a good heart when all is said and done.  Basically.  Anyway, it's a feel-good story.  Marisa Tomei is adorable.  6.2 out of 10

What can I say about Mona Lisa Vito? She is my spirit animal in this movie. Obviously Joe Pesci's performance is on point, but when is it not! But Marissa Tomei, "OH MA GAWD!" One of my favorite things to do, besides eat, is watch movies and impersonate my favorite scenes. My friends always ask me to do Marissa Tomei from My Cousin Vinny, and I immediately revert back to, "Your gonna shoot a deeah..." scene and I nail it every time (drunk or sober). Love her outfits and the white stripe going through her hair!
My Cousin Vinny is a hilarious movie with great performances and a solid plot. 4/5 stars
Enjoyable comedy displaying great chemistry between Joe Pesci and Marisa Tomei.

Good entertaining movie starring a very young marisa tomei and the guy from goodfellas and home alone who I always forget his name. I really enjoyed this movie, the chemistry between the two is phenomenal. I wonder if they did any other movies together besides this. And congrats on Marisa tomei winning an Oscar for this film, she was indeed the stand out in this movie.
Honestly the best trial movie

Once they start with any of the courtroom scenes though it gets really really good. Joe Pesci is amazing, Marisa tomei is amazing as well, the courtroom scenes are jaw dropping, and the movie is DEFINITELY a movie worth watching if you like these kinds of movies. Once you get past the first half this movie is great.

One of the best movies of all time. I've seen this movie around a dozen times and it's just as funny each time I see it. Joe Pesci and Marisa Tomei give performances of a lifetime. This is one of my top 10 movies of all times! Suberb lines and awesome acting. No rotten tomatoes here. This movie was the best! My Cousin Vinny utilizes Joe Pesci's mouthy attitude and Marisa Tomei's brilliant rendition of a New Yorker to create a hilarious court room drama. The film is fueled by a funny script and a ridiculous situation, which to me made it even more likable. This is a classic that shouldn't be missed
Joe Pesci and Marisa Tomei are brilliant together in this film! No wonder Marisa won an academy award for this film.
One of Joe Pesci's best movies and Marisa Tomei plays a blinder!!!!  Very funny; some great one liners.  A must see.

Allright, ''My Cousin Vinny'' (1992) is quite a stupid and ridiculous movie and it isnt that well made. The structure is off, there are massive tonal shifts, sudden character improvements, and revelations that dont make any sense. But my god, this movie is hilarious and entertaining.

The story is about two guys who are accused of murder in Alabama, they dont have any money for a proper attorney, so they hire their cousin Vinny, hilariously portrayed by Joe Pesci, Vinny is an inexperienced, loudmouth lawyer not accustomed to Southern rules and manners, and along side him he brings his fiancee Mona Lisa Vito (Yes really), portrayed by Marisa Tomei (This performance has always been infamous because she won an Academy Award for it, despite not being that great. and i agree, she shouldnt have won, but she really isnt bad. She is a funny character and Tomei gives life to the Yankee character)

That's all i'm going to say,  ''My Cousin Vinny'' (1992) is an hilarous movie, brimming with energy from start to finish, the plot (however conventional) is excellent. (The final scene in the courtroom is truly remarkable)

This movie may not be well made, but you sure are guaranteed to have a great time watching
Excellent fun comedy.  Many who rate do not know a good witty comedy if it snuck up and bit them in the behind!  This one is very good fun and can be watched again and again.
Best part of this movie is the chemistry between Vinny and Lisa. Everything else is hit or miss.

A different courtroom drama - where's there's not that much drama, but more comedy, and it's not all stupid, either! Vinny (Perci) is the relative/sort-of-lawyer called in to help his nephew (Macchio) who's on trial for murder. It's good fish-out-of-water stuff & Mona (Tomei) is good, if dressed ridiculously throughout! Fast-paced and fun, if not always hilarious, a good film.

My Cousin Vinny is a light-hearted legal comedy and is one of my favourite courtroom films ever. Marisa Tomei is the stand out performance - which is no doubt why she won a Best Supporting Actress Oscar.

An absolute classic.  Joe Pesci at his finest, as fish out of water New York lawyer Vinny Gambini, defending his very first murder case in southern Alabama.  Marisa Tomei, who won an Oscar for her role as Gambini's girlfriend Lisa, rounds out a strong supporting cast.  This court room drama will leave you laughing from start to finish.  A brilliant comedy worth watching.

"My Cousin Vinny" is hilarious from start to finish. Joe Pesci gives a great performance as Vinny Gambini who is the Brooklyn Lawyer and the slender ladies man. And Marisa Tomei is perfect as Mona Lisa Vito who is his sexy fiancee.
I love both Joe Pesci and Marisa Tomei.
I never get tired of watching this.

My Cousin Vinny was made in 1992, a time when comedies like these had a decent international release, and people actually went to the cinema to see them. Comedies like these - with a strong, but simple story, strong characters and great actors. These aren't around anymore, at least not in this format, and only get a limited theatrical release before going straight to video-on-demand, while the theaters are reserved for blockbusters. 

Joe Pesci obviously dominates here as a would-be Brooklyn Italian attorney who comes out to hicksville Alabama to defend his cousin and his best friend, two New York teenagers who get framed for murdering a convenient store clerk while driving across the country and checking out colleges. The story is simple, basic, but the cast makes it incredibly enjoyable. 

Marissa Tomei actually won an Oscar for Best Supporting Actress as Vinny's girlfriend, Mona Lisa Vito, and deserving so, but I couldn't help but think that today, a performance like hers would go unnoticed, simply because it was in a comedy, and comedies are unappreciated. Side note: she looks so good in this movie that you'll most likely have to pause it a couple of times. 

My Cousin Vinny is probably Ralph Macchio's last hit, even though the Karate Kid is a supporting actor here, after this one, he didn't make much, plus, this is probably the last movie where he played a teenager, which was a stretch, as he was about 31 at the time.

This is one of those movies that you should watch every couple of years, simply because it offers a decent amount of laughs and gives you comedic characters that you just enjoy spending time with. Plus, this is Joe Pesci at his best, and like George Carlin said: 'I pray to Joe Pesci because he gets shit done', and My Cousin Vinny is no exception.
Great job making a semi political movie with humor and a slightly intense case, a pure classic.
One of the funniest movies I have ever seen. The combination of Pesci and Tomei is genius and it shows.
While Marisa Tomei's Oscar win is probably the most questionable thing about this comedy, I won't get into that. This movie is not very funny or memorable at all.

The script is a bit dodgy and a few weird choices were made, but Pesci and Tomei play a fantastic chemistry, making My Cousin Vinny overall a funny and entertaining experience
The two leads have a ball and it shows in this otherwise ordinary comedy.

My Cousin Vinny is a humorous legal comedy. It joins the ranks of special comedies that deviated from the typical formula of the genre. With its intelligently written script and on point acting, it proved that playing stupid, goofy, and vulgar are not essential to be hilarious and delightful.
Very funny and sarcastic film with charismatic Joe Pesci.

My Cousin Vinny is a hilarious, guilty pleasure courtroom comedy. It has many things going for it: Joe Pesci in one of his best roles; Marisa Tomei in one of her best roles; intelligent screenwriting; and fast pacing so that the movie never lags. The many subtle messages and symbols throughout the movie are interesting too; one of the best comedies of that year.

Yes, it's pretty apparent that it's not very funny, but it's actually not bad. If there's one thing that stands out in this film, it's the acting. Sure, some of the characters can be outright unlikable, but the acting is really nice, especially coming from the film's star Joe Pesci. The plot seems iffy at times, but I think it's pretty good, even if the script lacks a lot humour. To be completely fair, the film may have a sense of humour that I clearly don't understand, probably because the subject matter is more for "sophisticated adults", but it still could have been a lot funnier. Otherwise, it's still mildly entertaining, if only due to the performance of its main cast.
outrageously funny...
Far funnier that I expected. Very light-hearted and the courtroom scene towards the end is thrilling.

During a cross-country road trip, two New Yorkers are arrested and jailed in Alabama after being mistaken as murderers of a convenience store clerk. In their desperation, they hire the cousin of one of them to be their lawyer, only to find out that Vinny has only recently become a lawyer, and has no real experience with legal procedure.

According to my research, this film is actually fairly accurate and realistic in terms of how it portrays legal procedures, trials, and that sort of thing. So, going by that, I can get behind this film for trying to do some *ahem* justice to its subject matter.

The film does occasionally dip into outdated and on the nose territory with some of the fish out of water elements, but overall, this is a pretty witty, sharp, and funny comedy.

Ralph Macchio is fine as Bill, but Mitchell Whitfield is only okay as his buddy Stan. As Bill's cousin Vinny, Joe Pesci is a delight. Lane Smith is fun as the prosecutor, Bruce McGill is fun as the sheriff, and Fred Gwynne (in his final film) is quite strong as the judge. The real scene stealer here though, is Marisa Tomei in her breakout Oscar winning performance as Vinny's loudmouth fiancee who is along for the ride. And then of course there's yet another turn by James Rebhorn in an antagonistic role. He's fine of course, but sometimes I wish I could see him go against type. 

The film is a bit dated and out of touch, and, like I said, goes for easy and obvious targets with its humor. All in all though, this is a a really funny and delightful film, so give it a watch if you haven't done so yet.
Probably the funniest movie I've ever seen. A pretty good story line with non-stop humor throughout. Also riveting.
A so-so exercise in stereotypes made enjoyable by the performances of Pesci and Tomei and featuring an excellent courtroom finale.
This may be the type of pleasant lower-brow comedy I'm inclined to enjoy less than the average person, but this movie earns my praise for its surprising in-court realism.
One of those enjoyable movies that stands up to more than one viewing.
AWESOME film.  Great courtroom dramatic comedy.  Marisa Tomei is soooooo funny.  Watch it!

A great film with all time hilarious performances. This also has a clever plot.
Although there is nothing too special in My Cousin Vinny, the hilarious cast and plot makes this movie an enjoyable comedy that is worth a watch.

An agreeable if minor fish-out-of-water comedy that is perfect for television viewing. Joe Pesci is a novice lawyer from New York hired by his cousin (Ralph Macchio) and a friend (Mitchell Whitfield) to defend them during a murder trial in a small Alabama town. This broad comedy gets laughs from the flamboyant New Yorkers appearing conspicuous amidst the reserved southerners. All of the characters are presented with equal affection as caricatures so there is no lapse into condescension. Pesci is inspired here and has never been more likable. Marisa Tomei is devastatingly funny as Pesci's highly agitated fiancée. In his final role, Fred Gwynne is marvelous in one of his most memorable performances as the querulous judge. There are no surprises in the script and it features customary pacing. But it's a modern comedy that endures. Tomei won the Oscar as Best Supporting Actress. Written by Dale Launer. Directed by Jonathan Lynn. With Lane Smith, Bruce McGill, Austin Pendleton.

Are we to believe that boiling water soaks into a grit faster in your kitchen then on any place on the face of the earth? Were these magic grits? Did you buy them from the same guy who sold Jack his beanstalk beans?
I loved this movie. The actors were good. The writing was great. Very funny!

Two friends Bill and Stan gets wrongfully arrested for murder when traveling through alabama, with no funds to pay for a lawyer they consider themselves lucky when they´re informed that Bill´s cousin Vinny from New york is an attorney and that he can take on the case. But when they realize how unexperienced Vinny is in court, their situation seems hopeless. "My Cousin Vinny" is a fun-filled fish out of water story with exceptional performances from both Pesci and Tomei, seeing Vinny trying to navigate through the Alabama legal system is quite hilarious and the film is one great courtroom comedy.
